Topic.Title: What will happen in Sanford.

Message.Msg: So you've been stalking me all along, but choose the opening hours of the conference to re-open an old wound and dump your warm margarita into it? In elementary school I DID once express an interest in the clarinet, but a cruel music teacher instead placed a plastic POS called a Flute-O-Fone in my hand and told me that if I practiced it "for a few years" I "might get to play the clarinet in the 6th-grade band". I was so enraged at being handed a clown toy instead of a real musical instrument that after a few weeks I smashed that cheap dog whistle over my brother's head and threw up a lifetime block against ever learning to read music. I hereby retract my offer of sushi and Ibogaine and fried horsie-dervies and demand the return of the manuscript for "The Testicular Piracy Theory of Human Transactional Behavior" . I further announce my boycott of your stupid Bundy-Dube Eco-Circle-Jerky (a moral position made somewhat easier to assume by the fact that I am currently being held in the Clark County Jail on charges of air piracy and transport of drug paraphernalia). This is one heartbreak too many for me, viewer. ROTFCMEO I hope you and shutupstellas find all the happiness together that you two deserve.

Topic.Title: today is a very good day for America - salut to George Zimmerman

Message.Msg: That's silly and irrelevant, showing your ignorance. If my teenager went back to confront the man who was following her, I would beat her myself. TM had 4 minutes of nobody following him in which to run home to daddy. He had a phone in his hand and could have called 911 for help. Instead, he called his GF and told her that he was going to beat that creepy#$%$ cracker. That's not fear, and you cannot turn it into fear. That's thuggery, it's a delusion of manhood, believing his bravado and expertise gained from previous schoolyard fights would carry the day. But most importantly, it was a premeditated assault and battery, and it's a felony. No ifs, no ands, no buts. If my kid did that, I would apologize to the person who had to shoot. TM was killed in the commission of a felonious act by a superior weapon in the hands of a trained user of that weapon. He got an unexpected outcome to his plans to beat up a Hispanic. That is all that exists to this story. You are irrelevant, your views are fantasy, and your attempts at self-importance are in vain.

Message.Title: Could Double Very Quickly
Message.Msg: There is a low market cap, undiscovered and extremely undervalued stock that pioneered video on demand (VOD) with Time Warner Cable (TWC) in 2000 and is now pioneering the next technology to revolutionize cable TV, Network DVR (nDVR). The company is Concurrent (CCUR) and it looks ready to explode to new 52-week highs this week. It is paying a HUGE dividend yield of 6.1%! CCUR was the first company to bring VOD to the market in 2000 when they deployed it for TWC and today, VOD is the fastest growing alternative TV viewing platform in the world - with CCUR's VOD delivery technology reaching 50 million households for a 30% market share. 1/2 of all U.S. TV households now have a DVR, but CCUR is about to make today's DVR technology obsolete with new cloud-based nDVRs. CCUR already deployed a form of its nDVR technology for TWC, which is powering TWC's extremely popular start-over/look-back services. Soon CCUR will begin deploying fully featured nDVR services for its pay-TV clients. CCUR's nDVR technology will allow anybody to record infinite television programs over the cloud, without a DVR box - and be played back on any device - including smartphones and tablets. CCUR closed last week at only $7.88 with a market cap of $68.98 million, cash of $22.37 million, and an enterprise value of $46.61 million or just 0.74X revenues and 6.54X operating cash flow. CCUR's main rival SEAC is about to hit a new 52-week high and is trading for 1.78X revenues and 15.92X operating cash flow. SEAC's valuation ratios would value CCUR between $15.41 and $15.52! Major consolidation is taking place in the cable TV industry and rumors are now circulating that TWC may acquire Cablevision, in order to catch up to Comcast's subscriber base. Cable TV operators are facing more competition than ever before and CCUR's technologies are critical to the success of this $100 billion industry! CCUR's fiscal 3Q 2013 EPS was up 450% from the 4Q of 2012 and CCUR's 10-K filing is coming next month!

Message.Title: DRAM $4.29 UP 20% LAST WEEK....TARGET $30+WHY??: 1) NEW MONSTER MEMORY MANUFACTURING DEAL WITH AMD, 2) MEMORY PRICES WAY UP, 3) DIVERSIFICATION
Message.Msg: The two biggest reasons for DRAMs incredible upside from todays prices are discussed below. In addition to these recent developments, DRAM will benefit from skyrocketing memory prices (it's main core business for the last several decades). DRAM was already on the verge of profitability even before the 2 factors mentioned above will have a significant positive effect on earnings in the current and future quarters, . The current 0.2 X sales compared to 1.5 sector average is ridiculous and will be corrected soon. DRAMs current market cap is only $8 million. There only 1.4M tightly held shares on the float. 1) AMD and DRAM announced in May (5/8/2013 AMD Press Release and 5/12/2013 DRAMPress Release) that DRAM will begin manufacturing all new AMD Gamer Series memory modules and will provide it's RAMDisk software to drive all AMD Radeon products. The Gamer Series memory is compatible with AMD and Intel platforms, supporting both AMP and XMP memory profiles. Recent reviews rank AMD Gamer Series memory the fastest and more reliable for gaming and other applications requiring super-fast processing speeds. "AMD Radeon RG2133 Gamer Series Memory is armed with features designed to outperform the competition on any task," said Roman Kyrychynskyi, product director, Graphics Business Unit, AMD. "Designed with multi-platform compatibility in mind, the AMD Radeon RG2133 brings cutting-edge technology, as well as uncompromising quality and compatibility for PC gamers. "AMD and Dataram have worked together to significantly enhance the dynamic background load-and-save feature in order to create a seamless, non-volatile RAMDisk experience," said Jason Caulkins, CTO, Dataram. "This underscores AMD and Dataram's continued dedication to delivering the highest-performing memory products. 2) DRAM is also pursuing it's RAMDisk technology in the energy, banking, simulations, military, medical, and other sectors requiring super-fast processing speeds.
